caption.center: JAMES ALVIN EVANS, APPELLANT, v. THE STATE OF FLORIDA, APPELLEE.

court.center: District Court of Appeal of Florida, Third District.

opinion.posture: Appeal from the Circuit Court, Dade County, Barbara Levenson, J.
opinion.attorneys:
James Alvin Evans, in pro. per.
Robert A. Butterworth, Atty. Gen., for appellee.
opinion.panel: Before SCHWARTZ, C.J., and NESBITT and GREEN, JJ.
opinion.opinion_text:
This court's opinion of December 28, 1994, is vacated and the following opinion is substituted in its place.
Although the trial court was mistaken in determining that the crime of which Evans was convicted, second degree grand theft, was a second degree felony, see ยง 812.014(2)(b)1, Fla. Stat. (1981) (providing that second degree grand theft is a third degree felony), rule 3.800 relief from his ten-year sentence was properly denied because the sentence in question was correctly imposed under the habitual offender statute. ยง 775.084(4)(a)3, Fla. Stat. (1981).
Affirmed.Page 1282
